For another version see [Observer (Wings of Liberty and Heart of the Swarm)](/starcraft2/Observer_(Wings_of_Liberty_and_Heart_of_the_Swarm) "Observer (Wings of Liberty and Heart of the Swarm)") ._ \[[e](https://liquipedia.net/starcraft2/index.php?title=Observer_%28Legacy_of_the_Void%29&action=edit§ion=0)\ \]\[[h](/starcraft2/Template:Infobox_unit "Template:Infobox unit")\ \]![Protoss](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/0/0f/Protoss_race_icon.png/30px-Protoss_race_icon.png%20%22Protoss%22) Observer [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/91/SC2Observer.jpg/600px-SC2Observer.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Observer.jpg) [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/91/SC2Observer.jpg/600px-SC2Observer.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Observer.jpg) Unit Information Type: Air Unit Description: Flying spy. Cloak renders the unit invisible to enemies without detection. Built From: [Robotics Facility](/starcraft2/Robotics_Facility_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Robotics Facility (Legacy of the Void)") Cost: [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals")  25 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/2/2e/Vespene-protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Gas "Gas")  75 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Buildtime_protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Game_Speed "Game Speed")  17.9 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/86/Supply-protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Supply "Supply")  1 [Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race") : B Unit stats Defense: ![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/e/e2/Icon_Hitpoints.png) 40 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/82/Icon_Shields.png)](/starcraft2/Plasma_Shield "Plasma Shield") 30 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/5/5e/Icon_Armor.png)](/starcraft2/Armor "Armor") 0 (+1) Attributes: [Light](/starcraft2/Light "Light") , [Mechanical](/starcraft2/Mechanical "Mechanical") , [Detector](/starcraft2/Detector "Detector") Sight: 11 (+2.75) Speed: 2.82 (+1.41) Strong against: * [Dark Templar](/starcraft2/Dark_Templar_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Dark Templar (Legacy of the Void)") * [Banshee](/starcraft2/Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Banshee (Legacy of the Void)") * [Roach](/starcraft2/Roach_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Roach (Legacy of the Void)") Weak against: * [Photon Cannon](/starcraft2/Photon_Cannon_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Photon Cannon (Legacy of the Void)") * [Missile Turret](/starcraft2/Missile_Turret_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Missile Turret (Legacy of the Void)") * [Spore Crawler](/starcraft2/Spore_Crawler_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Spore Crawler (Legacy of the Void)") Contents -------- * [1 Description](#Description) * [2 Abilities](#Abilities) * [3 Upgrades](#Upgrades) * [4 Competitive Usage](#Competitive_Usage) * [4.1 General](#General) * [4.2 Vs. Protoss](#Vs._Protoss) * [4.3 Vs. Terran](#Vs._Terran) * [4.4 Vs. Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [5 Gallery](#Gallery) * [6 Quotes](#Quotes) * [7 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [8 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Observer_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The **Observer** is a flying cloaked spy drone and [Detector](/starcraft2/Detector "Detector") for the [Protoss](/starcraft2/Protoss "Protoss") , built at the [Robotics Facility](/starcraft2/Robotics_Facility_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Robotics Facility (Legacy of the Void)") . It is permanently cloaked, so opponents need detection in order to see and kill the Observer. The Observer has a relatively slow flying speed, but its speed can be upgraded by researching [Gravitic Boosters](/starcraft2/Gravitic_Boosters "Gravitic Boosters") at the [Robotics Bay](/starcraft2/Robotics_Bay_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Robotics Bay (Legacy of the Void)") . Abilities\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Observer_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=2 "Edit section: Abilities")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Surveillance Mode | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/3/3f/Surveillance_Mode.png/62px-Surveillance_Mode.png)](/starcraft2/File:Surveillance_Mode.png) | **Caster:** [Observer](/starcraft2/Observer "Observer")

Allows the Observer to move at the cost of decreased sight radius. | [Detector](/starcraft2/Detector "Detector") | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/b/b4/Detector.gif)](/starcraft2/File:Detector.gif) | **[Range](/starcraft2/Range "Range")

Increases the movement speed of the Observer. Their speed and acceleration is increased by 50%. | Competitive Usage\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Observer_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=4 "Edit section: Competitive Usage")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### General\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Observer_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=5 "Edit section: General")\ \] As a general rule, the Observer should be acquired as soon as feasible in all builds, and should usually be the first unit produced out of the [Robotics Facility](/starcraft2/Robotics_Facility_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Robotics Facility (Legacy of the Void)") unless there is a pressing need for fast [Immortals](/starcraft2/Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Immortal (Legacy of the Void)") . Many players choose to [Chrono Boost](/starcraft2/Chrono_Boost "Chrono Boost") their Observer, as it provides defensive detection and invaluable scouting information on the opponent's army. Normally this first Observer is positioned at the choke of the opponent's base after completing scouting, as this is where most players mass up their armies before heading out. In all matchups it is wise to get Observers for detection, to provide vision of high ground areas during attacks, and for scouting throughout the match. This battlefield knowledge of enemy movements and tech choices is of paramount importance, and can help you prepare for an impending attack or provide you with an excellent opportunity to hit a vulnerable base. Because of their [sight](/starcraft2/Sight "Sight") range is significantly greater than any attack range of [static defense](/starcraft2/Static_defense "Static defense") , Observers can and should avoid being taken down in this way. However, the [detection](/starcraft2/Detection "Detection") range of these buildings matches the observer (when not in surveillance mode), which means that if your Observer can see static defense, it is visible to the enemy (sight ranges are all 11). This also implies that the only real threats to Observers are [scan](/starcraft2/Scan "Scan") and mobile detection. During the mid or late game Observers are often used to keep tabs on an opponents tech route or progress and also their economic situation, especially vs Zerg, to keep tabs on the number of bases that have been taken and the level of saturation on each. Multiple (2-3) observers will usually travel with the army to ensure some redundancy in case they get picked off, and can be split off to points of interest as required. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/ProtossIcon.png/30px-ProtossIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ProtossIcon.png) Protoss\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Observer_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=6 "Edit section: Vs. Protoss")\ \] Observers are used to obtain valuable scouting information, although it is wise to be careful with one's scouting observer if one's opponent also has Observers himself. They are also essential to countering [Dark Templar](/starcraft2/Dark_Templar_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Dark Templar (Legacy of the Void)") , which can ruin even the most perfectly planned midgame for Protoss. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Observer_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] It can be important to keep an Observer or two around your army with the [Banshee's](/starcraft2/Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Banshee (Legacy of the Void)") ability to cloak and attack Protoss ground units. Without proper detection, the Protoss army is susceptible to Terran surprise aerial attacks, and so it is essential to have an Observer with your troops. Similarly, due to the high ground and cliffing characteristics of the game, keeping an Observer near expansions can protect them from [Tank](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Siege Tank (Legacy of the Void)") harassment. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Observer_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=8 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] Observers are usually used to scout the Zerg's base and one is usually brought with the Protoss army for the midgame push to reveal any [burrowed](/starcraft2/Burrow "Burrow") [Banelings](/starcraft2/Baneling_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Baneling (Legacy of the Void)") , [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Roach (Legacy of the Void)") , [Infestors](/starcraft2/Infestor_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Infestor (Legacy of the Void)") , [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Lurker (Legacy of the Void)") or [Swarm Hosts](/starcraft2/Swarm_Host_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Swarm Host (Legacy of the Void)") . They are also useful for keeping track of [Mutalisks](/starcraft2/Mutalisk_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Mutalisk (Legacy of the Void)") as they fly around the map or near bases, giving the Protoss more reaction time to pull probes and move units to defend. They are also commonly used to spot for [Creep Tumors](/starcraft2/Creep_Tumor "Creep Tumor") to contain Zerg creep spread in the early game, or remove it before a push to make it more difficult for the Zerg to see and surround the push. Gallery\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Observer_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=9 "Edit section: Gallery")\ \] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/7/74/Observer.gif)](/starcraft2/File:Observer.gif) Quotes\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Observer_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=10 "Edit section: Quotes")\ \] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- * [Observer's sounds (video and sound)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2e0CRuS14ho) - YouTube video. Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [5 Gallery](#Gallery) * [6 Quotes](#Quotes) * [7 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [8 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Observer_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The **Observer** is a flying cloaked spy drone and [Detector](/starcraft2/Detector "Detector") for the [Protoss](/starcraft2/Protoss "Protoss") , built at the [Robotics Facility](/starcraft2/Robotics_Facility_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Robotics Facility (Legacy of the Void)") . It is permanently cloaked, so opponents need detection in order to see and kill the Observer. The Observer has a relatively slow flying speed, but its speed can be upgraded by researching [Gravitic Boosters](/starcraft2/Gravitic_Boosters "Gravitic Boosters") at the [Robotics Bay](/starcraft2/Robotics_Bay_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Robotics Bay (Legacy of the Void)") . Their speed and acceleration is increased by 50%. | Competitive Usage\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Observer_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=4 "Edit section: Competitive Usage")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### General\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Observer_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=5 "Edit section: General")\ \] As a general rule, the Observer should be acquired as soon as feasible in all builds, and should usually be the first unit produced out of the [Robotics Facility](/starcraft2/Robotics_Facility_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Robotics Facility (Legacy of the Void)") unless there is a pressing need for fast [Immortals](/starcraft2/Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Immortal (Legacy of the Void)") . Many players choose to [Chrono Boost](/starcraft2/Chrono_Boost "Chrono Boost") their Observer, as it provides defensive detection and invaluable scouting information on the opponent's army. Normally this first Observer is positioned at the choke of the opponent's base after completing scouting, as this is where most players mass up their armies before heading out. In all matchups it is wise to get Observers for detection, to provide vision of high ground areas during attacks, and for scouting throughout the match. This battlefield knowledge of enemy movements and tech choices is of paramount importance, and can help you prepare for an impending attack or provide you with an excellent opportunity to hit a vulnerable base. Because of their [sight](/starcraft2/Sight "Sight") range is significantly greater than any attack range of [static defense](/starcraft2/Static_defense "Static defense") , Observers can and should avoid being taken down in this way. However, the [detection](/starcraft2/Detection "Detection") range of these buildings matches the observer (when not in surveillance mode), which means that if your Observer can see static defense, it is visible to the enemy (sight ranges are all 11). This also implies that the only real threats to Observers are [scan](/starcraft2/Scan "Scan") and mobile detection. During the mid or late game Observers are often used to keep tabs on an opponents tech route or progress and also their economic situation, especially vs Zerg, to keep tabs on the number of bases that have been taken and the level of saturation on each. Multiple (2-3) observers will usually travel with the army to ensure some redundancy in case they get picked off, and can be split off to points of interest as required. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/ProtossIcon.png/30px-ProtossIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ProtossIcon.png) Protoss\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Observer_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=6 "Edit section: Vs. Protoss")\ \] Observers are used to obtain valuable scouting information, although it is wise to be careful with one's scouting observer if one's opponent also has Observers himself. They are also essential to countering [Dark Templar](/starcraft2/Dark_Templar_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Dark Templar (Legacy of the Void)") , which can ruin even the most perfectly planned midgame for Protoss. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Observer_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] It can be important to keep an Observer or two around your army with the [Banshee's](/starcraft2/Banshee_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Banshee (Legacy of the Void)") ability to cloak and attack Protoss ground units. Without proper detection, the Protoss army is susceptible to Terran surprise aerial attacks, and so it is essential to have an Observer with your troops. Similarly, due to the high ground and cliffing characteristics of the game, keeping an Observer near expansions can protect them from [Tank](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Siege Tank (Legacy of the Void)") harassment. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Observer_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=8 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] Observers are usually used to scout the Zerg's base and one is usually brought with the Protoss army for the midgame push to reveal any [burrowed](/starcraft2/Burrow "Burrow") [Banelings](/starcraft2/Baneling_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Baneling (Legacy of the Void)") , [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Roach (Legacy of the Void)") , [Infestors](/starcraft2/Infestor_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Infestor (Legacy of the Void)") , [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Lurker (Legacy of the Void)") or [Swarm Hosts](/starcraft2/Swarm_Host_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Swarm Host (Legacy of the Void)") . They are also useful for keeping track of [Mutalisks](/starcraft2/Mutalisk_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Mutalisk (Legacy of the Void)") as they fly around the map or near bases, giving the Protoss more reaction time to pull probes and move units to defend. They are also commonly used to spot for [Creep Tumors](/starcraft2/Creep_Tumor "Creep Tumor") to contain Zerg creep spread in the early game, or remove it before a push to make it more difficult for the Zerg to see and surround the push.
